title: Colorful Notting Hill Apartment Lists for £2.475 Million
text:
Every inch of this 1,310-square-foot apartment in Notting Hill, London, which listed earlier this month for £2.475 million, boasts color.



Hermione Russell, a sales negotiator with local listing agency Russell Simpson, said that “it’s a rarity to find a home with such distinctive flair, character and color,” in a news release.



The three-bedroom, two-bathroom apartment spans the two floors above The Dayrooms Cafe, an Australian coffee spot offering healthy brunch options. It was designed by local interior design firm Barlow & Barlow, known for creating young and exuberant spaces. The firm drew inspiration from the owner’s Cuban heritage and multicultural roots of the Notting Hill Carnival.

Mansion Global could not confirm the identity of the owner.



Visitors enter the front door into a private hallway of bright blue, mint green and pastel pink, listing photos show. Floor plans show a green pattern wallpapered reception room blend into an open-plan kitchen. The master bedroom on the second floor has an en-suite bathroom done with emerald green tiles, pink walls, and gold accents.



Up a geometric pink staircase is a private 433-square-foot roof terrace offering panoramic views of London. The space comes with an outdoor kitchen and an outdoor shower.

Notting Hill is an area known for its seven-day-a-week Portobello Road Market offering everything from fruit and bread to antiques, clothes or music, as well as the annual Notting Hill Carnival, a street festival that celebrates Caribbean and black diasporic cultures.
